pageContext.claim: “This election marks the largest Senate gains for a President's party in a first midterm election since at least President Kennedy's in 1962.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump spoke too soon at this post-election news conference, before all the races had been called. Democrat Kyrsten Sinema was later declared the winner of the Senate race in Arizona. In the end, Republicans gained two Senate seats in 2018. That's the same gain Republicans saw in 1970, when the first midterm elections of Richard Nixon's presidency were held.
